title: Beacons Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: David Spencer / Beacons Reservoir
images.caption: View of the southern end, looking west across the dam.

images.title: Ruth Sharville / Beacons Reservoir dam, with spillway in full spate
images.caption: Wonderful photo of the reservoir dam, with spillway in full spate

images.title: Alan Bowring / Grassy slopes of Gwaun Crew
images.caption: Grassy slopes of Gwaun Crew. This hillside rears up above the A470 as it passes the reservoir. Few folk venture onto the hill so it remains for the sheep - the one in the view was asleep despite the roar of Sunday traffic below.

description: Enjoy a lovely stroll around this pretty reservoir in the fantastic Brecon Beacons. The nearby mountains of Pen Y Fan and Corn Du make a simply stunning backdrop to the walk. The walk also includes woodland sections on the western side of the reservoir and several waterside sections. If you're looking for a more challenging walk you could climb Pen Y Fan. The start point for this walk is near the northern end of the reservoir. This walk also makes use of the Brecon Beacons Way so you could pick this up and head deeper into this beautiful national park.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head south from the site along the Taff Trail and it will take you to Cantref Reservoir, the waterfalls at the pretty Nant Ddu and Llwyn-on Reservoir where there's a nice circular trail. You'll also pass through the Garwnant Forest where there's a good visitor centre and several waymarked trails. The epic Cambrian Way passes the lake. The long distance waymarked route starts from the city of Cardiff and runs for nearly 300 miles through the Brecon Beacons, the Cambrian Mountains and Snowdonia before finishing on the North Wales coast at Conwy.

display_address: A4059, Glyn Tarell, Powys, Cymru / Wales, LD3 8NL, United Kingdom
